repnme.cdata!: Bosnia and Herzegovina - Land Registration Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Bosnia and Herzegovina
            Land Registration Project are as follows: outcomes were
            satisfactory, risk to development outcome was moderate and
            both Bank and borrower performance was satisfactory.
            Lessons learned were: (1) Focus in the early stages of
            similar projects in land registration development should be
            on establishing the functioning system rather than on the
            covering data. (2) In a country with limited IT capacity, an
            incremental, inclusive and compliant ICT development
            approach is the best practice. (3) Locally based real estate
            registration systems are no longer feasible in the 21st
            century. (4) An extensive results framework can be a
            positive factor in project implementation. (5) Focus on what
            is achievable and build on successes.

docna.cdata!: Bosnia and Herzegovina - Land Registration Project

Bosnia and Herzegovina - Land

repnme.cdata!:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Land Registration
            Project : restructuring

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Land Registration
            Project (LRP) for Bosnia and Herzegovina is to facilitate
            the orderly development of transparent land markets through
            registration of real estate rights and complimentary
            policies that enable transactions to be made with security
            and efficiency. This paper proposes an extension of the
            closing date until June 30, 2012. There are no changes to
            the project development objective, environmental assessment
            (EA) category, outcomes or the results monitoring framework.
            The project is currently rated as satisfactory and most
            project outcomes and targets have been met. The request for
            this change has been made by the Government in their letter
            dated February 16, 2012. The aide memoire and the management
            letter from the World Bank November 2011 mission recommended
            the extension in order to bridge the gap between the LRP and
            the Real Estate Registration Project (RERP) currently under
            preparation and to allow for the completion of all LRP
            project activities. The extra three month employment by land
            registration unit consultants will be sufficient to assist
            the government in completing preparation of the RERP.

display_title.display_title:
Bosnia and Herzegovina - Land
            Registration Project : restructuring (Vol. 2) : Data sheet

repnme.cdata!: Easier land registration in Bosnia and Herzegovina

abstracts.cdata!:
This result profile talks about the Land
            Registration Project for Bosnia and Herzegovina. The project
            aims to help citizens register real estate and exercise
            ownership rights efficiently and securely, so a transparent
            land market can develop. 37 land registry offices were
            renovated and equipped, improving conditions for staff and
            public. Customer service has improved around the country,
            and data, including information on mortgages and sales
            transactions, are available online. Over 1.6 million
            property folios have been digitized to insure that are
            easily and quickly accessible to everyone.

docna.cdata!: Easier land registration in Bosnia and Herzegovina

display_title.display_title:
Easier land registration in
            Bosnia and Herzegovina

repnme.cdata!: Land Registration Project in Bosnia and Herzegovina

abstracts.cdata!:
The development objective of Land
            Registration Project in Bosnia and Herzegovina is to
            facilitate the orderly development of transparent land
            markets through registration of real estate rights and
            complimentary policies that enable transactions to be made
            with security and efficiency. The key results achieved were
            as follows: (1) in 16 courts, including Sarajevo, 80 percent
            of all transactions are resolved in five days or less and
            mortgages are registered within a day; (2) 1.9 million
            hectares of cadastre maps have been digitized, exceeding the
            project target of 1.4 million hectares; (3) improvements in
            service delivery and to the physical infrastructure of 37
            offices, and corruption opportunities have been largely
            eliminated; and (4) new legislation covering land
            registration, spatial planning, cadastre, property taxation,
            and regularization of informal developments had been drafted
            and some enacted during the period of the project.

docna.cdata!: Land Registration Project in Bosnia and Herzegovina

Land Registration Project in
            Bosnia and Herzegovina
